alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 29 at 3:13PM MST until June 29 at 7:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Along and north-northwest of State Highway 89 near Jerome and Cottonwood. * WHEN...Until 615 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Water flowing over roadways will create slick paved roads and muddy unpaved roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 311 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Oak Wash, Verde River, Sycamore Creek, Oak Creek, Blowout Creek, Dry Creek, Spring Creek, Coffee Creek, Railroad Draw and Bitter Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sedona, Cottonwood, Bridgeport, Tuzigoot National Monument and Dead Horse Ranch State Park. - This includes the following highways... State Route 89A between mile markers 350 and 371. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well.
